Row.Text: You have stumbled into the land of the Guaycuru! I advise that you leave, before our raiders find you.
Kill me if you wish, but my people will resist you forevermore.
We will meet on the battlefield, then.
It is rare for me to hold a non-Guaycuru warrior in high regard... but it is not impossible. Let us make a public Declaration of Friendship to honor this occasion.
I will not be silent about your offenses. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
My men will strip your land of any food or weapons worth using. This is not an empty threat - it has already begun.
If you encroach upon our hunting grounds, we will reclaim them by force.
Bold of you to show your face here! Are you trying to get killed?
Welcome back to our camp! Perhaps we will throw a nimat√°q feast in your honor.
Good timing - I've only just returned from the bush.
Don't get too comfortable here.
Your military composition is interesting... very interesting. Perhaps I should visit your cities and steal their innovations.
What's caught your eye, then?
Impossible... I will have my revenge before long.
You do have some truly rare goods... perhaps there is merit in peaceful trade after all.
I will not rest until you are destroyed.
My people have been wandering into your land. I hope you do not find this objectionable.
If you can't make me a better offer than that, I will simply rob you on the spot.
Harvests have been poor in the bush. I hope there is some charity to be found in you.
Keep running your mouth like that, and someone may shut it by force.
It is too late. The raiders are already mobilized.
Excellent. I'll be off to survey the spoils I have gathered, then.
